info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 18 at 8:48PM CDT until May 19 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Green River at Rochester affecting Muhlenberg, Ohio and Butler Counties.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Green River near Mammoth Cave affecting Edmonson County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Green River near Mammoth Cave.
* WHEN...Until tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Green River Ferry closes to RV and trailer traffic due to high water. Heavy loads will be at the judgment of the ferry operator considering the 12 ton load limit of ferry. Backcountry camping on the Green River floodplain is prohibited. At 20.1 feet, Launching of paddle craft is prohibited. At 32.0 feet, Green River Ferry closes to all traffic due to high water.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 32.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CDT Sunday was 33.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 26.9 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34.6 feet on 02/12/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Monday morning at 700 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING
